CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 12 reads: "Support NIMS Program - Local business leaders and a top postal official are shown with Assistant Postmaster General Frederick C. Belen, second from left, who addressed the Pittsburgh Mail Users Council on the forward-looking program of NIMS (Nationwide Improved Mail Service), Left to right: E.G. Coll, the city's postmaster; Mr. Belen; Mark Nixon of Bell Telephone Co., chairman of the local NIMS committee, and William Chase, president of the Pittsburgh Chamber of Commerce. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait left to right: E.G. Coll, Frederick C. Belen, Mark Nixon, and William Chase holding booklet titled "NIMS Handbook of Helpful Hints", standing in front of poster for NIMS
